metadata.scenario: Technical support for a malfunctioning device

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: My SmartHome Hub isn't connecting to the internet. I've tried restarting it like five times, and it's still flashing red! This is incredibly frustrating; I rely on this for my security system.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration, especially regarding your security system. Let's troubleshoot this. Can you please tell me what model SmartHome Hub you have and what troubleshooting steps you've already taken besides restarting the device?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's the SmartHome Hub Pro, and honestly, restarting it was the only thing the quick start guide suggested. I also unplugged it for a few minutes, but that didn't help either. I'm not very tech-savvy, so I'm not sure what else to do.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, with the SmartHome Hub Pro, the flashing red light usually indicates an issue with the network connection. Have you checked if other devices on your network are working correctly? Also, could you try accessing the Hub's configuration page through a web browser by typing its IP address? You can find the IP address listed on the bottom of the device. Let me know what you see.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: The other devices are working fine. As for the IP address thing... I don't even know what a configuration page is or how to find the IP address listed on the bottom. And even if I found it, what do I do with it then? Is there an easier solution?
